Description: A data structure that follows the Last In, First Out (LIFO) principle, where the last element added is the first one to be removed.
A data structure that follows the First In, First Out (FIFO) principle, where the first element added is the first one to be removed.
The operation used to add an element to the top of a stack.
The operation used to remove the top element from a stack.
The operation used to add an element to the rear of a queue.
The operation used to remove the front element from a queue.
The operation that allows you to view the top element of a stack or the front element of a queue without removing it.
Stacks are often used in function call management, while queues are commonly used in scheduling tasks or handling requests.
